author: Michael Caines
method: Place the butter in a stainless steel saucepan and start to melt.  Add the apples, sugar and vanilla pod.  Cook out the apple to a compote, stirring from time to time for approximately 30 minutes on a moderate heat.  If the texture is too runny then leave to reduce until you have a  thick texture. Remove the vanilla pod, and reserve for use later. Place the apple compote into a blender, blend to a fine pulp and pass through a fine sieve.  Serve.
ingredients: 100g/3½oz unsalted butter,  750g/1lb 10oz Granny Smith apples, peeled, cored and chopped,  100g/3½oz caster sugar,  1 vanilla pod split
